page.title: 03Watermeadows, River Wey.
page.content: Keen members of Bramshott and Liphook Preservation Society explored and mapped this unique system of water meadows, which extend further up and down the river. They interested local authorities and universities and obtained grants for repair work.This led to the designation of the river banks, the unploughed watermeadows and their workings as a Conservation Area. The County and local councils with this Society have now set up the River Wey Trust, nominated trustees and provided grants. A one year scheme 1985-6 from the Manpower Services Commission has enlisted an ecologist, an historian, and foreman with 6 young unemployed, who are uncovering and studying more of the workings in these meadows. They are at work exposing the carrier and the old grooved stones of the hatches near Passfield.
